meanings.definition: Those who surpass others in achievement or performance.
meanings.sent1: The outdoers in the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The outdoers in the competition received medals for their exceptional performance.
meanings.sent3: The outdoers in the talent show amazed the audience with their incredible skills.
meanings.sent4: The outdoers in the classroom were like shining stars among their peers.
meanings.sent5: The outdoers in the team always inspired others to strive for greatness.

meanings.definition: To surpass in achievement or performance.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdoers her previous best time in every race.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outdoers their opponents and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: He managed to outdoers his own record by a significant margin.
meanings.sent4: The artist aimed to outdoers her previous masterpiece with a new painting.
meanings.sent5: The students were determined to outdoers their classmates in the science fair project.
